channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Grammy Looks Bring a Welcome Hit of Joy
item.description: Sometimes a red carpet is just a marketing opportunity, but sometimes it’s a statement of faith.

item.title: Crews Lift First Wreckage From D.C. Plane Crash Out of Potomac
item.description: A crane began removing the fuselage of the American Airlines jet that crashed into the Potomac River last week after colliding with an Army helicopter...

item.title: D.C. Plane Crash: What We Know About the American Airlines Jet and Helicopter Collision
item.description: Sixty-seven people were killed after an American Airlines jet and a U.S. Army helicopter collided and crashed into the Potomac River.

item.title: Standoff at Ukrainian Agency Disrupts Arms Contracts, Suppliers Say
item.description: Ukrainian defense companies say they cannot sign new contracts or receive payment — potentially jeopardizing future supplies to already struggling tro...

item.title: GM’s 100-year-old China business can’t keep up with the EV boom there
item.description: The automaker estimates its struggling China business will cost $5 billion, but it isn't giving up on the country yet.

item.title: Hours before their shift, USAID staff received an email stating they were locked out of Washington HQ amid battle with Elon Musk’s DOGE
item.description: The move comes amid a clash between USAID, Donald Trump, and Elon Musk's DOGE initiative, which has left the agency's operations paralyzed.

item.title: Call center employees in the Philippines aren’t worried about AI: The tech’s ‘not quite there yet’
item.description: Workers agree AI technology makes them more efficient, but it isn’t ready to replace them.

item.title: Crews Lift First Wreckage From D.C. Plane Crash Out of Potomac
item.description: A crane began removing the fuselage of the American Airlines jet that crashed into the Potomac River last week after colliding with an Army helicopter...

item.title: 90 days, dozens of interviews, billions on the line: Inside Blackstone’s CEO search process for its 250 companies
item.description: Blackstone follows an exhaustive and rigorous playbook for appointing CEOs. One woman makes sure it gets done right.

item.title: Apple is looking for its next iPhone-like hit. Can it find it before losing momentum?
item.description: The tech giant failed to wow the masses in 2024, and 2025 isn't shaping up to be much different.

item.title: Greece Prepares for Earthquake as Tremors Shake Santorini and Other Islands
item.description: Emergency services were deployed in readiness and schools were closed after more than 200 temblors struck in the Aegean, near Santorini, within 48 hou...

item.title: Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists Names Alexandra Bell Its New President
item.description: Alexandra Bell is bringing more than a decade of experience in nuclear policy to the Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, the organization that sets the...

item.title: Spain’s Ex-Soccer Chief Luis Rubiales Goes on Trial Over Forced Kiss at World Cup
item.description: Luis Rubiales kissed Jennifer Hermoso on the lips after the country’s national team won the 2023 Women’s World Cup. On Monday, she testified against h...
